meanings.definition: To cover or obscure with a blank or empty space.
meanings.sent1: She was blanking out the mistakes on her paper.
meanings.sent2: The artist was blanking the canvas before starting a new painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved blanking out the card's suit.
meanings.sent4: The fog was blanking the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The snow was blanking the ground, creating a serene landscape.

meanings.definition: A swear word used to replace profanity.
meanings.sent1: He let out a loud blanking when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent2: The comedian used a clever blanking in place of a curse word.
meanings.sent3: The child's innocent blanking made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The pirate's speech was full of colorful blankings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the students not to use any blanking in class.

meanings.definition: The act of intentionally ignoring or avoiding someone.
meanings.sent1: Her blanking of him was evident by her turning away.
meanings.sent2: The blanking at the party made him feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The blanking game they played ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: His blanking of the difficult conversation was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The blanking between the two friends was causing tension in the group.
